task_summary: Pick up the canned spam and place it into the sink using a robotic manipulator arm, as evidenced by the 9 contact-sheet frames.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a robotic arm operating in a domestic kitchen environment. The robot is to find and grasp a can of spam from the countertop, transport it, and accurately place it into the sink. The process must ensure object detection, stable grasping, motion alignment, and a successful, safe placement. The workspace includes cabinets, a faucet, and visible clutter, so precise control is required.
preconditions: The spam can is present and accessible on the counter.
The robot is powered, calibrated, and its gripper is empty.
The sink is empty and able to receive the can.
No occluding obstacles between robot and objects.
stepwise_plan: Perceive the spam can and confirm visibility.
Approach and align above the can.
Compute grasp pose and open gripper.
Lower until contact and close gripper to secure the can.
Perceive the sink and move above it.
Place the can in the sink.
success_criteria: Spam can is grasped and no longer on the counter.
Can is released entirely within the confines of the sink.
No objects are dropped en route.
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: retry scan three times, else abort.
Grasp fails: reattempt from approach, else abort.
Place location not detected: rescan, else abort.
Unexpected collision detected: retreat and recompute path.
task_long_description.termination: The behavior terminates when the can is securely released in the sink and the arm retreats.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Put the canned spam into the sink

node_specs.description: Check if the spam can is visible.
Scan for the spam can using a raster pattern.
Detect the spam can with a perception action.
Move TCP above the spam can.
Compute a top grasp pose for the can.
Approach the can and align precisely for grasp.
Lower the gripper until 5N contact is detected.
Check if the sink is visible.
Place the spam can onto the sink area.
Open gripper to release the can.

failure_modes: Can can't be grasped or grasp is unstable
Collision or object dropped during transfer
recovery_strategy: Retry scanning for can or sink up to three times
If grasp or placement fails, backtrack and try approach again
Retreat on unexpected contact or error
assumptions: Instruction matches the visual context; spam can is visually confirmed present.
No discrepancies between instruction and visual frames.
No requirement to open a container.

expected_success_criteria: Spam can ends inside sink; not held by gripper.
